title: Reset inspection countdown and warnings after each solve

requirements.summary: Reset the inspection countdown state to 15.00s immediately when a solve completes (timer enters the "stopped" state), so the next inspection always starts from 15.00s.
acceptanceCriteria: Given an inspection is started and the countdown reaches any value (e.g., 11 seconds remaining), when the user completes a solve (timer stops and a result is recorded), the internal inspection countdown state is reset to exactly 15,000ms.
After a solve completes, starting the next inspection always begins from 15.00 seconds and does not resume from the previous inspectionâ€™s remaining time.
This behavior works for both Spacebar and touch/pointer interactions.

file_operations.description: Update the solve-completion logic (when transitioning into the "stopped" state) to immediately reset inspection countdown-related state back to 15,000ms (including any internal remaining-time tracking) so subsequent inspections always begin at 15.00s for both keyboard (Space) and pointer/touch flows.

requirements.summary: Reset inspection warning state after each solve so 8s and 5s warnings can trigger normally on the next inspection only.
acceptanceCriteria: After a solve completes, starting the next inspection can play the 8-second warning once and the 5-second warning once as the countdown crosses those thresholds, even if warnings were triggered during the previous inspection.
No inspection warning audio plays immediately upon solve completion; warnings only occur during a subsequent inspection countdown.

file_operations.description: Ensure that when a solve completes (timer enters "stopped"), the internal inspection warning flags/state are cleared (so 8s/5s warnings can fire again on the next inspection), without triggering any warning audio during the stop transition.
